hints.label: alg-scutoid-construction
hints.title: Scutoid Tessellation Construction
hints.content:
610: :label: alg-scutoid-construction
611: 
612: **Input**:
613: - Algorithmic log $\mathcal{L}$ containing all episodes $\{e_i\}$ with birth/death times and positions
614: - Swarm states $\{S_t\}$ for $t \in [0, T]$ (discrete timesteps)
615: - Spatial metric $g(x, t)$ at each timestep
616: 
617: **Output**:
618: - Scutoid tessellation $\mathcal{T} = \{\mathcal{S}_i : e_i \in \mathcal{E}\}$
619: - Cell type classification (prism vs. scutoid)
620: - Geometric properties (volume, curvature) for each cell
621: 
622: **Procedure**:
623: 
624: 1. **For each timestep** $t \in \{0, \Delta t, 2\Delta t, \ldots, T\}$:
625:    - Extract alive walker positions $\{x_i(t) : i \in \mathcal{A}(t)\}$
626:    - Compute Riemannian Voronoi tessellation $\mathcal{V}_t$ using metric $g(\cdot, t)$
627:    - Store Voronoi cells $\{\text{Vor}_i(t)\}$ and neighbor sets $\{\mathcal{N}_i(t)\}$
628: 
629: 2. **For each episode** $e_i$ with lifetime $[t_i^{\text{birth}}, t_i^{\text{death}})$:
630:    - Identify parent episode $e_j = \text{parent}(e_i)$ (from cloning log)
631:    - Extract top face: $F_{\text{top}} = \text{Vor}_i(t_i^{\text{death}}) \times \{t_i^{\text{death}}\}$
632:    - Extract bottom face: $F_{\text{bottom}} = \text{Vor}_j(t_i^{\text{birth}}) \times \{t_i^{\text{birth}}\}$
633: 
634: 3. **Determine cell type**:
635:    - Compute neighbor change: $\Delta \mathcal{N} = \mathcal{N}_i(t_i^{\text{death}}) \triangle \mathcal{N}_j(t_i^{\text{birth}})$ (symmetric difference)
636:    - If $\Delta \mathcal{N} = \emptyset$: **Prism** (Type 0)
637:    - If $|\Delta \mathcal{N}| = 2$: **Simple scutoid** (Type 1)
638:    - If $|\Delta \mathcal{N}| > 2$: **Complex scutoid** (Type k)
639: 
640: 4. **Construct lateral faces**:
641:    - For each boundary segment of $\partial F_{\text{bottom}}$ (connecting to neighbor $k$):
642:      - If $k \in \mathcal{N}_i(t_i^{\text{death}})$ (neighbor persists):
643:        - Create **ruled surface** by geodesic interpolation from bottom to top
644:      - If $k \notin \mathcal{N}_i(t_i^{\text{death}})$ (neighbor lost):
645:        - Create **mid-level vertex** at time $t_{\text{mid}} = (t_i^{\text{birth}} + t_i^{\text{death}})/2$
646:        - Terminate geodesic ruling at mid-level vertex
647:    - For each boundary segment of $\partial F_{\text{top}}$ (connecting to neighbor $\ell$):
648:      - If $\ell \notin \mathcal{N}_j(t_i^{\text{birth}})$ (new neighbor):
649:        - Originate geodesic ruling from mid-level vertex to top
650: 
651: 5. **Compute geometric properties**:
652:    - Volume: $\text{Vol}(\mathcal{S}_i) = \int_{\mathcal{S}_i} \sqrt{\det(g_{\text{ST}})} \, dx \, dt$ (numerical integration)
653:    - Face curvatures: $K_{\Sigma}$ for each lateral face $\Sigma$ (discrete differential geometry)
654:    - Holonomy: Parallel transport around face boundaries (Section 5.2)
655:

607: We now provide an algorithmic procedure to construct the scutoid tessellation from the Fractal Set data.
608: 
609: :::{prf:algorithm} Scutoid Tessellation Construction
610: :label: alg-scutoid-construction
611: 
612: **Input**:
613: - Algorithmic log $\mathcal{L}$ containing all episodes $\{e_i\}$ with birth/death times and positions
614: - Swarm states $\{S_t\}$ for $t \in [0, T]$ (discrete timesteps)

619: - Cell type classification (prism vs. scutoid)
620: - Geometric properties (volume, curvature) for each cell
621: 
622: **Procedure**:
623: 
624: 1. **For each timestep** $t \in \{0, \Delta t, 2\Delta t, \ldots, T\}$:
625:    - Extract alive walker positions $\{x_i(t) : i \in \mathcal{A}(t)\}$
626:    - Compute Riemannian Voronoi tessellation $\mathcal{V}_t$ using metric $g(\cdot, t)$
627:    - Store Voronoi cells $\{\text{Vor}_i(t)\}$ and neighbor sets $\{\mathcal{N}_i(t)\}$
628: 
629: 2. **For each episode** $e_i$ with lifetime $[t_i^{\text{birth}}, t_i^{\text{death}})$:
630:    - Identify parent episode $e_j = \text{parent}(e_i)$ (from cloning log)
631:    - Extract top face: $F_{\text{top}} = \text{Vor}_i(t_i^{\text{death}}) \times \{t_i^{\text{death}}\}$
632:    - Extract bottom face: $F_{\text{bottom}} = \text{Vor}_j(t_i^{\text{birth}}) \times \{t_i^{\text{birth}}\}$
633: 
634: 3. **Determine cell type**:
635:    - Compute neighbor change: $\Delta \mathcal{N} = \mathcal{N}_i(t_i^{\text{death}}) \triangle \mathcal{N}_j(t_i^{\text{birth}})$ (symmetric difference)
636:    - If $\Delta \mathcal{N} = \emptyset$: **Prism** (Type 0)
637:    - If $|\Delta \mathcal{N}| = 2$: **Simple scutoid** (Type 1)
638:    - If $|\Delta \mathcal{N}| > 2$: **Complex scutoid** (Type k)
639: 
640: 4. **Construct lateral faces**:
641:    - For each boundary segment of $\partial F_{\text{bottom}}$ (connecting to neighbor $k$):
642:      - If $k \in \mathcal{N}_i(t_i^{\text{death}})$ (neighbor persists):
643:        - Create **ruled surface** by geodesic interpolation from bottom to top
644:      - If $k \notin \mathcal{N}_i(t_i^{\text{death}})$ (neighbor lost):
645:        - Create **mid-level vertex** at time $t_{\text{mid}} = (t_i^{\text{birth}} + t_i^{\text{death}})/2$
646:        - Terminate geodesic ruling at mid-level vertex
647:    - For each boundary segment of $\partial F_{\text{top}}$ (connecting to neighbor $\ell$):
648:      - If $\ell \notin \mathcal{N}_j(t_i^{\text{birth}})$ (new neighbor):
649:        - Originate geodesic ruling from mid-level vertex to top
650: 
651: 5. **Compute geometric properties**:
652:    - Volume: $\text{Vol}(\mathcal{S}_i) = \int_{\mathcal{S}_i} \sqrt{\det(g_{\text{ST}})} \, dx \, dt$ (numerical integration)
653:    - Face curvatures: $K_{\Sigma}$ for each lateral face $\Sigma$ (discrete differential geometry)
654:    - Holonomy: Parallel transport around face boundaries (Section 5.2)
655: 
656: 6. **Output** tessellation $\mathcal{T}$ with all cells and properties.

hints.label: prop-computational-cost
hints.title: Computational Cost
hints.content:
663: :label: prop-computational-cost
664: 
665: The scutoid tessellation construction has time complexity:
666: 
667: $$
668: O(T/\Delta t \cdot N \log N \cdot d)
669: $$
670: 
671: where:
672: - $T/\Delta t$ is the number of timesteps
673: - $N$ is the number of walkers (episodes per timestep)
674: - $\log N$ factor from Voronoi computation (Fortune's algorithm or similar)
675: - $d$ is the spatial dimension
676: 
677: **Space complexity**: $O(T/\Delta t \cdot N \cdot d)$ to store all Voronoi cells.
678: 
679: **Bottleneck**: Riemannian geodesic distance computation for Voronoi tessellation (requires solving differential equations on curved manifolds).
680: 
681: **Mitigation**:
682: - Use **approximate geodesics** (Euclidean distances with metric correction)

666:

669: $$

671: where:

673: - $N$ is the number of walkers (episodes per timestep)
674: - $\log N$ factor from Voronoi computation (Fortune's algorithm or similar)
675: - $d$ is the spatial dimension
676: 
677: **Space complexity**: $O(T/\Delta t \cdot N \cdot d)$ to store all Voronoi cells.
678: 
679: **Bottleneck**: Riemannian geodesic distance computation for Voronoi tessellation (requires solving differential equations on curved manifolds).
680: 
681: **Mitigation**:
682: - Use **approximate geodesics** (Euclidean distances with metric correction)
683: - **Coarse-graining**: Compute tessellation only at selected timesteps

hints.label: thm-scutoid-ig-duality
hints.title: Scutoid Tessellation is Dual to Information Graph
hints.content:
690: :label: thm-scutoid-ig-duality
691: 
692: The scutoid tessellation $\mathcal{T}$ and the Information Graph (IG) from Chapter 13 are **dual structures**:
693: 
694: **IG structure** (Chapter 13.3):
695: - **Vertices**: Episodes $e_i \in \mathcal{E}$
696: - **Edges**: Selection coupling $(e_i, e_j)$ if both alive during a cloning event
697: 
698: **Scutoid tessellation**:
699: - **Cells**: Scutoid volumes $\mathcal{S}_i$ corresponding to episodes $e_i$
700: - **Shared faces**: Two cells $\mathcal{S}_i$ and $\mathcal{S}_j$ share a lateral face iff episodes $e_i$ and $e_j$ are simultaneous neighbors (Voronoi cells adjacent at some time $t$)
701: 
702: **Duality statement**: An edge $(e_i, e_j)$ exists in the IG if and only if the corresponding scutoid cells $\mathcal{S}_i$ and $\mathcal{S}_j$ share a face in the tessellation.
703: 
704: **Proof**: By definition, IG edges connect episodes that are both alive during a cloning event, meaning their Voronoi cells are adjacent in space. Adjacent Voronoi cells at time $t$ imply the corresponding spacetime scutoids share a lateral face.
